item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, May 9, 2025 at 6:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. ALICE detects the conversion of lead into gold at the LHC (262 points | 162 comments)
2. In the Network of the Conclav: How we "guessed" the Pope using network science (26 points | 6 comments)
3. Launch HN: Nao Labs (YC X25) – Cursor for Data (48 points | 26 comments)
4. Past, present, and future of Sorbet type syntax (51 points | 24 comments)
5. Sofie: open-source web based system for automating live TV news production (181 points | 22 comments)
6. 21 GB/s CSV Parsing Using SIMD on AMD 9950X (155 points | 63 comments)
7. Show HN: BlenderQ – A TUI for managing multiple Blender renders (28 points | 2 comments)
8. Show HN: A backend agnostic Ruby framework for building reactive desktop apps (35 points | 13 comments)
9. Rollstack (YC W23) Is Hiring TypeScript Engineers (Remote US/CA) ( | hide)
10. Show HN: Aberdeen – An elegant approach to reactive UIs (137 points | 69 comments)
11. Itter.sh – Micro-Blogging via Terminal (104 points | 34 comments)
12. Show HN: Oliphaunt – A native Mastodon client for macOS (29 points | 8 comments)
13. Show HN: Hydra (YC W22) – Serverless Analytics on Postgres (20 points | 10 comments)
14. LegoGPT: Generating Physically Stable and Buildable Lego (488 points | 128 comments)
15. Show HN: Hyvector – A fast and modern SVG editor (183 points | 43 comments)
16. CryptPad: An Alternative to the Google Suite (91 points | 26 comments)
17. Data manipulations alleged in study that paved way for Microsoft's quantum chip (151 points | 100 comments)
18. The Anarchitecture Group (15 points | 1 comment)
19. Cell Mates: Extracting Useful Information from Tables for LLMs (5 points | discuss)
20. The birth of AI poker? Letters from the 1984 WSOP (25 points | 2 comments)
21. NSF faces shake-up as officials abolish its 37 divisions (291 points | 392 comments)
22. Implementing a Struct of Arrays (89 points | 28 comments)
23. The CL1: the first code deployable biological computer (21 points | 10 comments)
24. A Taxonomy for Rendering Engines (33 points | 7 comments)
25. Former Supreme Court justice David Souter has died (53 points | 22 comments)
26. Show HN: Agents.erl (AI Agents in Erlang) (16 points | 3 comments)
27. Hollow Core Fiber (HCF) (39 points | 20 comments)
28. Amazon's Vulcan Robots Now Stow Items Faster Than Humans (157 points | 184 comments)
29. The Linux Kernel's PGP Web of Trust (58 points | 9 comments)
30. Starlink User Terminal Teardown (264 points | 90 comments)
